If you are late for a very important meeting due to the sudden printer was broken or jamming. This disruption will affect your business core activities if proper handling is not taken. To handle such type of activities, Incident Management exists. This will help your organization and caller users as soon as possible. Sometimes we call Incident Management as call management, request management or ticketing management.

In other words, Incident Management is a procedure of IT service management (ITSM). It is a method to restore the disruptions of the organization’s services as quickly as possible. The main objective of Incident Management is not to find the main cause of disruption rather restore the problem. The basic tool used for the analysis of problems is an error database (KEDB) that is maintained by problem management. The other tool used for the same purpose is the incident model. This will identify whether the same problem occurred in the past or not.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” column_structure=”1_2,1_2″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ z_index_tablet=”500″]

1. Benefits of Incident Management

  •         Enhance efficiency and productivity of business services
  •         A detailed and transparent understanding of incidents
  •         Give more insight into top-level quality services
  •         Quick resolve issues regarding incidents
  •         Improve staff productivity and efficiency
  •         Motivate your business agents and employees
  •          Better communication between user and employees

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ z_index_tablet=”500″]

2. Incident Management Process

  •         Incident Identification
  •         Incident Logging
  •         Incident Classification
  •         Incident Prioritization
  •         Investigation and diagnosis
  •          Incident resolution and closure

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ z_index_tablet=”500″]

Roles and responsibilities of the Incident Manager

An incident manager is the one who manages and controls the industry incident management issues and adopts the best techniques and strategies of Incident Management in the process.

 

What task Incident Manager performs

  • Good setup of the entire process with respect to business requirements
  • Make process uphold and meeting SLA’s
  • Manage and maintain up-to-speed of various levels of an incident team (L1, L2, and L3)
  • Use standard solutions and create annual reports
  • Maintain the Key Performance Indicators (KPI)
  • Acts as a good medium to solve any business services disruptions
  • Well-coordinated to his/her team for excellent output A disaster is of any unforeseen event that interrupts the normal functioning of IT operations in a business or put business at risk. 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
